intro: Escobariopsis pennispinosa, commonly known as the spinyliverwort, is a small, delicate moss-like plant belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form and is typically found in rocky or sandy habitats. The plant has a dense, mat-forming structure with closely appressed leaves that are often covered in a layer of fine, spinulose structures. Escobariopsis pennispinosa is well adapted to arid environments, displaying desiccation tolerance and a slow growth rate. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies of pioneer plant communities.
